page.shortlink: api client api a5 listbox class

argument.name: containerId
argument.description: The ID of the element the list should be rendered in.

argument.name: data
argument.description: Data to display in the list.

argument.name: settings
argument.description: Settings for the list. This will override the initial values of the properties of the A5.ListBox class.

discussion.p: The list control is built for handling tabular data. The data passed into the list can be javascript object or strings. There are a few custom list data items that can be used to add items such as titles, static HTML and separators.

In order to inject a title, and object with a property named "*title" can be used. The value of the "*title" property will be injected into the HTML for the title. A property of "className" can be used to set a custom class name on the title. A property of "navigate" set to a value of "false" can be used to make the title not appear in the list group navigator (if one is defined for the list).

In order to inject static HTML, and object with a property named "*static" can be used. The value of the "*static" property can be either a string of HTML to inject, or a function that will return that HTML. A property of "className" can be used to set a custom class name on the container for the static HTML.
To insert a separator, a string of "-" can be used.

In list item templates the "[scope]" template command will be the list class, through which methods and properties can be accessed. The "[temp]" template command contains an automatically created object named "info". This object has several useful properties. These are "renderIndex", "index", "isFirst" and "isLast". The "renderIndex" is the index of the list as viewed, whereas the "index" is the original index of the data for the list item in the array passed in to the list. The "isFirst" and "isLast" properties are booleans that indicate whether or not the list item is the first or last item in the list.

property.name: theme
property.description: The theme to use on the list.

property.name: override
property.description: The overrides to use on the list.

property.name: inputId
property.description: The ID of the INPUT into which the value of the list should be set every time the list value changes.

property.name: className
property.description: The class name to put on the list container element.

property.name: focusClassName
property.description: The class name to put on the list container element when the list has focus.

property.name: disabledClassName
property.description: The class name to put on the list container element when the list has been disabled.

property.name: captureFocus
property.description: Whether or not to allow the list to capture focus. If set to true, then when the list is clicked on it will receive focus, and keyboard navigation can be done.

property.name: multiple
property.description: Whether or not the list allows multiple values to be selected.

property.name: separator
property.description: The separator string to use for combining multiple values when the value is being put into the INPUT specified by A5.ListBox.inputId.

property.name: selectionMode
property.description: The method by which multiple selection occurs. By default the CTRL or SHIFT key must be pressed to select additional values. Setting the value to "additive" will allow multiple values to be selected without the use of a keyboard.

property.name: loopNavigate
property.description: Whether or not the list should loop keyboard navigation through values in the list. If set to false (the default) then pressing the down key when the list has focus will not jump back to the top of the list once the last item in the list is hit. Setting the value to true will loop the navigation back to the beginning.

property.name: loopNavigateNullSelection
property.description: Whether or not the allow for a null value to be selected while loop navigating. If set to true (the default) then after navigating passed the end of the list, a null value will be selected before the first value in the list is.

property.name: allowNullSelection
property.description: Whether or not to allow the list to have a null selection.

property.name: allowNullDeselection
property.description: Whether or not to allow the list to deselect an item if there are no other values selected in the list.

property.name: allowAnyValue
property.description: Whether or not to allow the list to be set to have any value, regardless of whether that value is in the list. This is useful if the list needs to allow values that have been filtered out of the list to remain selected.

property.name: allowTextSelection
property.description: Whether or not to allow text selection in the list.

property.name: calculateValue
property.description: A function that receives the data for a row, and returns the value that the row should have based on the data. For example, if the list row data had an ORDERID field, the function could return that value, and then when the user clicked on a row, the value of the list would be the ORDERID of the row clicked on.

argument.name: data
argument.description: The data for the row.

property.name: scroll
property.description: Scroll settings for the list.

property.name: axis
property.description: The axis to allow scrolling on. Values can be "x", "y" or "both".

property.name: layout
property.description: Name of the layout to use.

property.name: layouts
property.description: The definition of named layouts to use in the A5.ListBox. See *[link:A5.ListBox Layout Object]*.

property.name: data
property.description: Settings for data.

property.name: defaults
property.description: An optional object that contains the default values to place in a row in the list if the row is missing those values.

property.name: nullHTML
property.description: The HTML to use when a column of data in a row is null or undefined.

property.name: columnLayout
property.description: Settings for columnar layouts.

property.name: header
property.description: Settings for headers in column layouts.

property.name: show
property.description: Whether or not to show column headers in the list when the list uses a columnar layout.

property.name: className
property.description: The class name to put on the column header element.

property.name: item
property.description: Settings for individual column headers.

property.name: className
property.description: The class name to put on a column header element.

property.name: hoverClassName
property.description: The class name to put on a column header element when the user hovers over it.

property.name: order
property.description: Settings for the order indicator in column headers.

property.name: ascendingImage
property.description: The image to use for the column when it is sorted in ascending order.

property.name: descendingImage
property.description: The image to use for the column when it is sorted in descending order.

property.name: className
property.description: The class name to put on the order image.

property.name: style
property.description: The CSS to put on the order image.

property.name: resize
property.description: Settings for column resizing.

property.name: location
property.description: Location for the resize handle. Value can be "before" or "after".

property.name: className
property.description: The class name of the indicator element shown over the column while it is being resized.

property.name: handle
property.description: Settings for column resizing handle.

property.name: className
property.description: The class name to put on the column resize handle.

property.name: size
property.description: The size in CSS units of the column resize handle.

property.name: data
property.description: Settings for columns in each row in the list.

property.name: item
property.description: Settings for individual columns in each row in the list.

property.name: className
property.description: The class name to put on a column in a row in the list.

property.name: style
property.description: The CSS to put on a column in a row in the list.

property.name: view
property.description: Settings to control list virtualization.

property.name: type
property.description: The type of virtualization to use. The default value of "default" will result in all rows of the list being render. A value of "page" will dynamically page the rows of the list. A value of "dynamic" will append rows as the user scrolls.

property.name: size
property.description: The number of rows to draw in the view. The default value is 50.

property.name: maxSize
property.description: The maximum number of rows that can be drawn in a "dynamic" view, before the view is cleared to reduce the DOM footprint of the list. The default value of "0" allows there to be no maximum size.

property.name: offset
property.description: In a "page" view, the "offset" is the number of rows to include from the previous page when when drawing a new page. For example, if the user was on a page that ended on row 100, and they navigated to the next page, the first visible row in the new page would be 90 if the offset was 10. In general the offset want to at least be the number of rows visible in the list, so that when the new page is drawn the scroll position of the list can appear not to change.

property.name: navigation
property.description: Settings for the navigation of views.

property.name: event
property.description: When the onNavigate event should be fired. The default value of "navigate" will fire the onNavigate event only when the page changes. A value of "scroll" will fire the event when the user scrolls, and the start and end will be the first and last visible indexes instead of the first and last indexes of the page. A value of "both" will fire the onNavigate event when the page is changed and when the list is scrolled.

property.name: pull
property.description: Settings for automatic pull navigation of views.

property.name: allow
property.description: Whether or not to allow automatic navigation when the user pulls past either end of the list. The default value is true.

property.name: size
property.description: The number of pixels that the user must pull past either end of the list before the release will result in an automatic page navigation. The default is 40.

property.name: prev
property.description: Settings for the previous page button.

property.name: html
property.description: The HTML to display in the previous button that will be drawn at the top of the page. The default value is "Prev".

property.name: className
property.description: The class name to put on the button.

property.name: pressedClassName
property.description: The class name to put on the button when it is pressed, or the automatic pull size is reached.

property.name: next
property.description: Settings for the next page button.

property.name: html
property.description: The HTML to display in the next button that will be drawn at the bottom of the page. The default value is "Next".

property.name: className
property.description: The class name to put on the button.

property.name: pressedClassName
property.description: The class name to put on the button when it is pressed, or the automatic pull size is reached.

property.name: group
property.description: Settings for the list group generation and navigation.

property.name: auto
property.description: An array of *[link:A5.ListBox Group Object]* definitions to use for grouping. The groups are processed in order, so if the array has more then one group object, each group object will be evaluated on each of the previously generated groups.

property.name: collapse
property.description: Group collapse settings.

property.name: allow
property.description: Specify when groups should be collapsible. Values can be "never" (the default), "programmatic" to only allow programmatic collapsing of groups using the *[link:A5.ListBox.setGroupCollapse]* method, "title" to allow toggling of a group by clicking on the title of the group, or "icon" to only allow an icon in the group title to control toggling of the group.

property.name: auto
property.description: If "true" groups will be automatically collapsed by default. The default is "false".

property.name: indicator
property.description: Settings for the collapse/expand indicator.

property.name: collapse
property.description: The HTML to inject in the indicator placeholder when the group is expanded. By default a value of "-" is used.

property.name: expand
property.description: The HTML to inject in the indicator placeholder when the group is collapsed. By default a value of "+" is used.

property.name: navigator
property.description: Settings for the list group navigator. For example the alphabetic bar on the side of a contacts list.

property.name: show
property.description: Whether or not to show the navigator. The default value is false.

property.name: location
property.description: The location of the navigation. The default value is "right". Other values include "left", "top", and "bottom".

property.name: offset
property.description: The distance in pixels from the edge of the list the navigator will be positioned. The default value is 4.

property.name: size
property.description: The collapsed size of the navigator in pixels. When the user is interacting with the navigator it will grow so that all text in the navigator is visible. The default value is 28.

property.name: process
property.description: A function that receives the title for a group, and can process the HTML to display in the group navigator.

argument.name: title
argument.description: The title of the group.

property.name: className
property.description: The class name to put on the navigator.

property.name: focusClassName
property.description: The class name to put on the navigator when the user is interacting with it.

property.name: style
property.description: The CSS to put on the navigator.

property.name: scroller
property.description: Settings for the list scroller.

property.name: show
property.description: Whether or not to show the scroller. The default value is false.

property.name: header
property.description: Settings for the list fixed header.

property.name: show
property.description: Whether or not to show the header.

property.name: html
property.description: The HTML to put in the list header.

property.name: className
property.description: The class name to put on the list header.

property.name: style
property.description: The CSS to put on the list header.

property.name: footer
property.description: Settings for the list fixed footer.

property.name: show
property.description: Whether or not to show the footer.

property.name: html
property.description: The HTML to put in the list footer.

property.name: className
property.description: The class name to put on the list footer.

property.name: style
property.description: The CSS to put on the list footer.

property.name: lock
property.description: Settings for the list lock. See *[link:A5.ListBox.setLock]*.

property.name: className
property.description: The class name to put on the list lock element.

property.name: html
property.description: The default HTML to put in the list lock element.

property.name: content
property.description: Settings for the list scrolling content area.

property.name: className
property.description: The class name to put on the list content.

property.name: header
property.description: Settings for the list content header. The content header will scroll of the top of the list but will not be re-drawn when the list is refreshed.

property.name: show
property.description: Whether or not to show the header.

property.name: html
property.description: The HTML to put in the list header.

property.name: className
property.description: The class name to put on the list header.

property.name: style
property.description: The CSS to put on the list header.

property.name: footer
property.description: Settings for the list content footer. The content footer will scroll of the top of the list but will not be re-drawn when the list is refreshed.

property.name: show
property.description: Whether or not to show the footer.

property.name: html
property.description: The HTML to put in the list footer.

property.name: className
property.description: The class name to put on the list footer.

property.name: style
property.description: The CSS to put on the list footer.

property.name: item
property.description: Settings for the list items.

property.name: className
property.description: The class name to put on a list item.

property.name: hoverClassName
property.description: The class name to put on a list item when the user mouses over it.

property.name: selectedClassName
property.description: The class name to put on a list item when it is selected.

property.name: style
property.description: The CSS to put on a list item.

property.name: titleClassName
property.description: The class name to put on a list group title item.

property.name: separatorClassName
property.description: The class name to put on a list item separator.

property.name: items
property.description: The definition of named items to be used in layouts. See *[link:A5.ListBox Item Object]*.

property.name: animation
property.description: Settings for list animations.

property.name: swap
property.description: Settings for the list swap animation, which can be optionally played on the population of the list. See *[link:A5.ListBox.populate]*.

property.name: flow
property.description: The direction the list will animate based on whether it is going to the next or previous set of data. The default value is "ltr", "rtl" may also be used.

property.name: duration
property.description: The length of time (in milliseconds) that the animation should take. The default value is 600.

property.name: lock
property.description: Settings for the list lock animation, which which controls the fade of the list lock element. See *[link:A5.ListBox.setLock]*.

property.name: duration
property.description: The length of time (in milliseconds) that the animation should take. The default value is 200.

property.name: disabled
property.description: Whether or not the list is disabled.

property.name: readOnly
property.description: Whether or not the list is read-only.

property.name: filter
property.description: The filter to apply to the list data. See *[link:A5.ListBox.setFilter]*.

property.name: order
property.description: The order to sort the list data in. See *[link:A5.ListBox.setOrder]*.

property.name: selection
property.description: The indexes of the selected list rows.

property.name: selectionData
property.description: The data of the selected list rows.

property.name: selectionKey
property.description: The indexes of the selected list rows before ordering and filtering.

property.name: value
property.description: The values of the selected list rows.

property.name: state
property.description: State information object.

property.name: group
property.description: The state of the lists grouping.

property.name: active
property.description: True if the list is currently has grouping.

property.name: view
property.description: The state of the view page if the view type is "page" or "dynamic".

property.name: start
property.description: The start index of the current view page.

property.name: end
property.description: The end index of the current view page.

property.name: hasPrev
property.description: Whether or not there is a previous page.

property.name: hasNext
property.description: Whether or not there is a next page.

property.name: onBeforePopulate
property.description: Event fired before the list is populated with data. If a value of false is returned by the function the populate will not be done.

argument.name: data
argument.description: The data the list is being populated with.

property.name: onPopulate
property.description: Event fired when the list is populated with data.

argument.name: data
argument.description: The data the list was populated with.

property.name: onBeforeListClear
property.description: Event fired before the contents of the list are cleared. This is useful if there are elements in the list content that need to be move for later use.

property.name: onBeforeListDraw
property.description: Event fired before the contents of the list are drawn. At this point the data to be drawn can be manipulated before display.

argument.name: data
argument.description: The data to draw.

argument.name: index
argument.description: The index in the data at which drawing is starting.

argument.name: source
argument.description: The source of the draw command. Values can be "populate", "append-rows", "view-nav" and "view-add".

property.name: onListDraw
property.description: Event fired when the contents of the list are drawn.

argument.name: data
argument.description: The data drawn.

argument.name: index
argument.description: The index in the data at which drawing started.

property.name: onBeforeItemDraw
property.description: Event fired before a list item is drawn. At this point the data to be drawn can be manipulated before display.

argument.name: data
argument.description: The data for the list item.

argument.name: index
argument.description: The index of the list item.

property.name: onGroupDraw
property.description: Event fired when a group of list items is drawn.

argument.name: group
argument.description: The name of the group.

argument.name: element
argument.description: The element that surrounds the group.

argument.name: titleElement
argument.description: The group title element.

argument.name: contentElement
argument.description: The element that surrounds the items in the group.

property.name: onItemDraw
property.description: Event fired when a list item is drawn.

argument.name: data
argument.description: The data for the list item.

argument.name: index
argument.description: The index of the list item.

property.name: onBeforeSelect
property.description: Event fired before an item in the list is selected. If a value of false is returned by the function the selection will not be done.

argument.name: index
argument.description: The index of the item being selected. If the index is equal to "-1" then no value is being selected.

property.name: onSelect
property.description: Event fired when an item in the list is selected.

argument.name: index
argument.description: The index of the item being selected. If the index is equal to "-1" then no value is being selected.

property.name: onChange
property.description: Event fired when the value of the list changes.

argument.name: value
argument.description: The value of the value.

property.name: onClick
property.description: Event fired when an item in the list is clicked.

argument.name: value
argument.description: The value clicked.

property.name: onDblClick
property.description: Event fired when an item in the list is double clicked.

argument.name: value
argument.description: The value double clicked.

property.name: onRightClick
property.description: Event fired when an item in the list is context clicked.

argument.name: value
argument.description: The value context clicked.

property.name: onNavigate
property.description: Event fired when the view in the list is navigated.

argument.name: start
argument.description: The start index of the view.

argument.name: end
argument.description: The end index of the view.

argument.name: type
argument.description: The type of navigation. The value will be "scroll" if the event was fired by a scroll, and "page" if it is fired by page navigate.

property.name: onBeforeAddRows
property.description: Event fired before rows are added to the list. If a value of false is returned by the function the addition will not be done.

argument.name: data
argument.description: The data for the list items being added.

argument.name: source
argument.description: The source of the row addition.

argument.name: type
argument.description: The source type. Value you will "append" or "insert".

argument.name: index
argument.description: If the type is "insert" then the index at which the new rows will be added.

property.name: onAddRows
property.description: Event fired when rows are added to the list.

argument.name: data
argument.description: The data for the list items added.

argument.name: source
argument.description: The source of the row addition.

argument.name: type
argument.description: The source type. Value you will "append" or "insert".

argument.name: index
argument.description: If the type is "insert" then the index at which the new rows were be added.

property.name: onBeforeRemoveRows
property.description: Event fired before rows are removed from the list. If a value of false is returned by the function the remove will not be done.

argument.name: rows
argument.description: The indexes of the rows being removed.

property.name: onRemoveRows
property.description: Event fired when rows are removed from the list.

argument.name: rows
argument.description: The indexes of the rows removed.

property.name: onBeforeUpdateRow
property.description: Event fired before a row is updated. If a value of false is returned by the function the update will not be done.

argument.name: index
argument.description: The index of the item being updated.

argument.name: data
argument.description: The updated data for the row.

property.name: onUpdateRow
property.description: Event fired when a row is updated.

argument.name: index
argument.description: The index of the item updated.

argument.name: data
argument.description: The updated data for the row.

property.name: onBeforeFilter
property.description: Event fired before the list is filtered. If a value of false is returned by the function the filter will not be done.

argument.name: filter
argument.description: The new filter for the list.

property.name: onFilter
property.description: Event fired when the list is filtered.

property.name: onBeforeOrder
property.description: Event fired before the list is ordered. If a value of false is returned by the function the order will not be done.

argument.name: order
argument.description: The new order for the list.

property.name: onOrder
property.description: Event fired when the list is ordered.

property.name: onBeforeResize
property.description: Event fired before the list is resized. If the layout of the list is changed by this event, then the list will preform a refresh to update to the new layout.

argument.name: width
argument.description: The new width of the list in pixels.

argument.name: height
argument.description: The new height of the list in pixels.

property.name: onResize
property.description: Event fired when the list is resized.

property.name: onFocus
property.description: Event fired when the list receives focus.

property.name: onBlur
property.description: Event fired when the list looses focus.

page.note: To get a pointer to the A5.ListBox class in a UX see *[link: dialog.object.getControl Method Object]*.
